title: Potato Latkes
ingredients: 1 large egg, beaten, or more to taste
½ teaspoon salt, or more to taste
¼ cup peanut oil for frying, or as needed
method: Step 2: Slice peeled potatoes and run through a food processor fitted with the grater attachment. Place shredded potatoes in a cheesecloth and wring, extracting as much moisture as possible.
Step 3: Measure 2 cups shredded, drained potatoes and place into a medium bowl; save any extra for another use. Add egg, flour, onion, and salt, and stir until well combined.

Step 4: Heat 1/4 inch of oil in a large, heavy-bottomed skillet over medium-high heat. Place large spoonfuls of potato mixture into the hot oil, pressing down on them to form 1/4- to 1/2-inch-thick patties. Cook until golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes. Flip and repeat on the other side.
Step 5: Remove to a paper towel-lined plate to drain while you cook any remaining latkes. Serve hot.
